lines.text:
[Final lines voiceover]
I once told you, Ryan, if only one gets out, it's a victory.

[referring to Fincham and the Britsh]
It took 200 years to turn out these men, Sergeant. It took me 90 days.
They;re nuts, sir.
Maybe so, but it's their ball game.
And we're still shut out!
We did that good with just a sergeant!
Now we got us a bird-colonel.
A bird colonel outranks a bird brain... clear?

[contemtuously after Ryan walks away]
Bird is right... chicken!
OK, OK, now we know we're on our own.
Major, you will order the men to strip.
[pause]
Major, I said "strip." Get it? All clothes, off. Naked.
[Major turns around]

[Yelling]
Parade...
[his voice drops]
strip.
You'll get your Iron Cross now, "Von" Ryan!
It would take you too long to strangle a man Colonel. The average Nazi would get impatient while you were doing it.

[to Gabriella, obviously the mistress of the Nazi Von Klemment]
Um... uh... What on Earth are you doing here, my child?

[amazed at his naiivety]
Oh, Padre, you are priceless!
He says you are no gentleman, colonel.
Only by an act of Congress.
I once told you Ryan, if only one gets out, it's a victory.
If you crab this, the Germans won't have to kill you; I'll do it myself.

[after Ryan spares Battaglia]
You fool! You soft-headed sentimental fool!
That's privilege of rank.
Damn your rank!

[to Orde, who is guarding Von Klemment]
Lieutenant, if he wiggles, put a hole in him.
Captain Costanzo, I said strip off all your clothes.
Sorry, sir, but I take being a member of the cloth literally.
[the men laugh]
I bow to your convictions, Captain.
